QuestionStatement: An aggregate supply curve may be horizontal over some range because within that range
AnswerChoices: A higher price level leads to higher interest rates, which reduce the money supply and consumer spending
Changes in the aggregate price level do not induce substitution
Output cannot be increased unless prices and interest rates increase
Rigid prices prevent employment from fluctuating
Resources are underemployed and an increase in demand will be satisfied without any pressure on the price level

QuestionStatement: Which of the following relationships is illustrated by a short-run Phillips curve?
AnswerChoices: A decrease in the rate of inflation is accompanied by an increase in the rate of economic growth
A decrease in the rate of inflation is accompanied by a decrease in the rate of economic growth
An increase in the rate of inflation is accompanied by a decrease in the rate of economic growth
An increase in the rate of inflation is accompanied by an increase in the rate of unemployment
A decrease in the rate of economic growth is accompanied by a decrease in the rate of unemployment

QuestionStatement: Which of the following could cause simultaneous increases in inflation and unemployment?
AnswerChoices: A decrease in government spending
A decrease in the money supply
A decrease in the velocity of money
An increase in inflationary expectations
An increase in the overall level of productivity

QuestionStatement: The long-run aggregate supply curve is likely to shift to the right when there is
AnswerChoices: An increase in the cost of productive resources
An increase in productivity
An increase in the federal budget deficit
A decrease in the money supply
A decrease in the labor force

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is a basic tenet of classical economic analysis?
AnswerChoices: Saving is usually greater than investment
The economy is self-correcting to full employment
The economy may be in equilibrium at less than full employment
Inflation is not a serious economic problem
The prices of products tend to be inflexible

QuestionStatement: Which of the following will most likely result from a decrease in government spending?
AnswerChoices: An increase in output
An increase in the price level
An increase in employment
A decrease in aggregate supply
A decrease in aggregate demand

QuestionStatement: Current equilibrium output equals $2,500,000, potential output equals 2,600,000 and the marginal propensity to consume equals 0.75.  Under these conditions, a Keynesian economist is most likely to recommend
AnswerChoices: Decreasing taxes by $25,000
Decreasing taxes by $100,000
Increasing government spending by $25,000
Increasing government spending by $33,333
Increasing government spending by $100,000

QuestionStatement: An inflationary gap could be reduced by
AnswerChoices: An increase in government spending
An increase in the supply of money
An increase in the income tax rate
A decrease in the discount rate
A decrease in the reserve requirement

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is true of supply shocks?
AnswerChoices: They tend to change both relative prices and the general price level in the economy
They affect only the general price level
They can be anticipated and offset with appropriate fiscal policy
They can be anticipated and offset with appropriate monetary policy
They make the aggregate supply curve vertical

QuestionStatement: Suppose that, from 1985 to 1986, unemployment fell from 7.2 to 7.0 percent and inflation fell from 3.8 to 1.1 percent.  An explanation of these changes might be that the
AnswerChoices: Aggregate demand curve shifted to the left
Aggregate demand curve shifted to the right
Aggregate supply curve shifted to the left
Aggregate supply curve shifted to the right
Short-run Phillips curve shifted to the right

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is a key feature of Keynesian economics?
AnswerChoices: The level of saving depends mostly on interest rates
The level of government expenditure depends mostly on interest rates
Supply creates its own demand
Macroeconomic equilibrium can occur at less than full employment
Wages are more flexible than prices

QuestionStatement: If a large increase in total spending has no effect on real gross domestic product, it must be true that
AnswerChoices: The price level is rising
The economy is experiencing high unemployment
The spending multiplier is equal to 1
The economy is in short-run equilibrium
Aggregate supply has increased

QuestionStatement: According to Keynesian theory, the most important determinant of saving and consumption is the
AnswerChoices: Interest rate
Price level
Level of income
Level of employment
Flexibility of wages and prices

QuestionStatement: Faced with a large federal budget deficit, the government decides to decrease expenditures and tax revenues by the same amount.  This action will affect output and interest rates in which of the following ways?
AnswerChoices: A
B
C
D
E

QuestionStatement: The graph above depicts an economy’s aggregate demand and aggregate supply curves.  If aggregate demand remains constant, the equilibrium price levels in the short run and in the long run will be which of the following?
AnswerChoices: A
B
C
D
E

QuestionStatement: An increase in energy costs will most likely cause the price level and real gross domestic product to change in which of the following ways?
AnswerChoices: A
B
C
D
E

QuestionStatement: Which of the following arguments is typically associated with classical economists?
AnswerChoices: A market economy is self-correcting and thus will not remain in an recession indefinitely
A market economy has stable prices and thus is usually free from inflation
A market economy requires a strong government to ensure that the market meets the needs of the people
A market economy needs only moderate assistance from the government to avoid an extended recession
A market economy eventually results in monopolies in both the input and output markets

QuestionStatement: Which of the following will occur if the federal government runs a budget deficit?
AnswerChoices: The expenditure multiplier will increase
The size of the national debt will increase
The economy’s output will decrease
State governments will run a budget surplus to offset the federal deficit
Interest rates will tend to decline

QuestionStatement: According to the Keynesian savings schedule, when aggregate income increases by a given amount, savings will
AnswerChoices: Remain the same
Decrease the amount of the change in income
Increase by the amount of the change in income
Increase by less than the amount of the change in income
Increase by more than the amount of the change in income

QuestionStatement: An inflationary gap can be eliminated by all of the following EXCEPT
AnswerChoices: An increase in personal income taxes
An increase in the money supply
An increase in interest rates
A decrease in government spending
A decrease in net exports

QuestionStatement: A contractionary supply shock would most likely result in
AnswerChoices: An increase in aggregate demand
An increase in national income
An increase in gross domestic product
A decrease in the general price level
A decrease in employment

QuestionStatement: The economy is currently experiencing
AnswerChoices: Inflation
Recession
Expansion
Stagflation
Rapid Growth

QuestionStatement: The minimum increase in government spending necessary to reach full employment is

If the economy is operating in the intermediate range of the aggregate supply curve and if aggregate demand increases due to an increase in net exports, then the price level, output, and the unemployment rate are most likely to change in which of the following ways?
AnswerChoices: A
B
C
D
E

QuestionStatement: The value of the spending multiplier decreases when
AnswerChoices: Tax rates are reduced
Exports decline
Imports decline
Government spending increases
The marginal propensity to save increases
